post.body: Impressive: RT: tferriss The most impressive 27-year old you've never heard of? Barack Obama's speechwriter: http://tr.im/2k3k
it was truly something The 2 that popped the charts were: Charmes Chabertin '02 & Dominus '91. Both were exquisite :)
lol! I had 4 just a week ago. Felt out of it the entire day! What we suffer through in order to travel...:)
Wonderful, because that is just what I opened! :)
No I don't. Any suggestions?
lol. I would do that too ;)
Tell me more about the tweetup tasting room pls
RT: cnn Winter storm rips into Midwest, Northeast http://tinyurl.com/48hr8v and check this pic: http://is.gd/cxQM
some journey indeed! How glad I am I live today and just imagine what awaits us tomorrow!
Thanks all for ur best wishes on my flight. It's already snowing in Milwaukee . Crossing my fingers that flights are on time! Merry Xmas!
getting ready for flight to England. Hopefully the storm will hold off until we've departed.
Also tasted Martinelli, Jackass Vineyard, 04; Killiakanoon, Clare Valley 04 & Ornellaia, Tuscany, 1993 http://ericaschoice.com/archives/75
Do you like Pinots? Check my rating/review at http://ericaschoice.com/archives/75 Tasted: Martinelli, Charmes Chambertin Grand Cru & D ...
Stay warm everyone and good morning!
I am excited to spend the Holidays in England. Any suggestions of new restaurants/clubs in London to check out?
Temp: -18° CCondition : Mostly Cloudy/WindFeels Like: -32° CWind: 48 km/hWant to come visit? :)
After yet 5 more inches snow last night, temperature plummeted 2 degr with wind chill of -24. Any wine suggestion to warm me up on icy day?
off to Edgar Calypso for dinner http://www.edgarscalypso.com/edgarscalypso/and then to watch King Solomon at Up and Under.
So my white elephant gift turned out to be "America", by John Stewart. How cool is that?!
Snow in Milwaukee. This is crazy. http://is.gd/cxQM
